posts.post_content: And now, with the advent of Worldwake, we now have somethin' better to put on this gal than Gorgon Flail. posts.post_content: Nope, Deathtouch's "Creatures dealt damage by this creature are destroyed" effect applies to any damage. The secondary Deathtouch effect that lets you distribute its combat damage at will only affects combat damage, however.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
I finally made my G/W archer deck, and man I love Brigid. The only downside is my friend always sighs and refuses to attack for 5 or more turns until he can either overrun me or hope to pull a removal for her. [Greatbow Doyen](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Greatbow Doyen)+Brigid is one of the best combo's I can think of in terms of damage, but it really makes the game drag on because no one will want to attack you until she is gone.  
  
Still a 5/5 for me.

posts.post_content:
Actually, Shadoflaam, if you've already got [Basilisk Collar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Basilisk Collar) on her, then [Kusari-Gama](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kusari-Gama) won't add anything more to the combo. All of the blockers would already be getting deathtouched, so the extra damage won't kill them any further, and the extra damage from the KG is coming from the equipment, not the creature, so the lifelink wouldn't apply to it either.  
  
Although, if you don't have Basilisk Collar out yet, then the KG will serve to make her a lot more lethal.
posts.html:
Actually, Shadoflaam, if you've already got Basilisk Collar on her, then Kusari-Gama won't add anything more to the combo. All of the blockers would already be getting deathtouched, so the extra damage won't kill them any further, and the extra damage from the KG is coming from the equipment, not the creature, so the lifelink wouldn't apply to it either.

Although, if you don't have Basilisk Collar out yet, then the KG will serve to make her a lot more lethal.
